Package ohos.workscheduler

Class WorkScheduler

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.app.AbilityContext
      • ohos.aafwk.ability.Ability
        • ohos.workscheduler.WorkScheduler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ILifecycle, Context

    public abstract class WorkScheduler
extends Ability
    Provides methods of starting, stopping, canceling, and updating a work and implementing the service logic for the Particle Ability.

    You must implemement onWorkStart(ohos.workscheduler.WorkInfo) and onWorkStop(ohos.workscheduler.WorkInfo) for each work. This ensures that the service logic can be successfully implemented if the triggering condition is met after a work is started by WorkSchedulerService. Once WorkInfo is defined, you can manage the work status using methods such as stopWork(ohos.workscheduler.WorkInfo) and stopAndCancelWork(ohos.workscheduler.WorkInfo).

    Since:
    3
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.ResourceSchedule#WORK_SCHEDULER

    • Method Detail

      • onWorkStart

        public abstract void onWorkStart​(WorkInfo work)
        Implements the part of service logic upon startup of a work. Once the preset triggering condition is met, WorkSchedulerService calls this method to execute the work defined by WorkInfo.

        Note: A work runs in the background after being started and therefore it must comply with the the rules of BackgroundTaskManager. Once WorkSchedulerService calls this method to start a work, BackgroundTaskManager marks the work as a background task, collects statistics on its running time, and keeps checking whether the work meets the requirement for running in the background. For more details, see BackgroundTaskManager. And you should acquire an running lock for yourself, if you don't want be halt by system suspend when your work is running

        Parameters:
        work - Indicates the work to be started by WorkSchedulerService. Ensure that WorkInfo of the work is valid.
        Since:
        3

      • onWorkStop

        public abstract void onWorkStop​(WorkInfo work)
        Implements the part of service logic upon stopping of a work. If the preset triggering condition is no longer met, WorkSchedulerService calls this method to notify the work to stop running.

        Note: WorkSchedulerService will call this method when detecting that the preset triggering condition of the work is no longer met. The work should end the service logic being executed and save key information in time to prevent data loss.

        Parameters:
        work - Indicates the work to be stopped by WorkSchedulerService. Ensure that WorkInfo of the work is valid.
        Since:
        3

      • startWork

        public static final boolean startWork​(WorkInfo work,
                                      boolean startNow)
                               throws RemoteException
        Notifies WorkSchedulerService to add a work to the execution queue.

        Note: A work can be executed only when it meets the preset triggering condition and complies with the rules of BackgroundTaskManager.

        Parameters:
        work - Indicates the work to be added to the execution queue. Ensure that the specified value is valid. Otherwise, a failure occurs when calling this method.
        startNow - Indicates execute the work immediately. Note: A work can be executed immediately if the associated application is running in the foreground. Otherwise, it must meet the preset triggering condition and comply with the rules of BackgroundTaskManager.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the work is successfully added to the execution queue; returns false otherwise.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - Throws this exception if the connection to WorkSchedulerService fails.
        Since:
        3

      • stopWork

        public static final boolean stopWork​(WorkInfo work)
                              throws RemoteException
        Notifies WorkSchedulerService that a work can be stopped.

        Note: When this method is called, WorkSchedulerService removes the work from the execution queue and notifies BackgroundTaskManager that the work can be stopped. At this time, the wakeup lock applied by WorkSchedulerService will be removed.

        Parameters:
        work - Indicates the work that can be stopped. Ensure that the specified value is valid. Otherwise, a failure occurs when calling the method.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the notification is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - Throws this exception if the connection to WorkSchedulerService fails.
        Since:
        3

      • stopAndCancelWork

        public static final boolean stopAndCancelWork​(WorkInfo work)
                                       throws RemoteException
        Notifies WorkSchedulerService that a work can be stopped and canceled.

        Note: When this method is called, WorkSchedulerService stops and cancels the work. To start the work, you need to explicitly call startWork(ohos.workscheduler.WorkInfo, boolean) again.

        Parameters:
        work - Indicates the work to be stopped and canceled. Ensure that the specified value is valid. Otherwise, a failure occurs when calling the method.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the notification is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - Throws this exception if the connection to WorkSchedulerService fails.
        Since:
        3

      • getWorkStatus

        public static final WorkInfo getWorkStatus​(int workID)
                                    throws RemoteException
        Obtains the latest status of a work.
        Parameters:
        workID - Indicates the ID of the work. Ensure that the specified value is valid.
        Returns:
        Returns the valid work status obtained from WorkSchedulerService if the specified workID is valid; returns null otherwise.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - Throws this exception if the connection to WorkSchedulerService fails.
        Since:
        3

      • obtainAllWorks

        public static final List<WorkInfo> obtainAllWorks​()
                                           throws RemoteException
        Obtains all pieces of work associated with the current application.
        Returns:
        Returns all pieces of work associated with the application.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - Throws this exception if the connection to the WorkScheduler service fails.
        Since:
        5

      • stopAndClearWorks

        public static final boolean stopAndClearWorks​()
                                       throws RemoteException
        Stops and cancels all pieces of work associated with the current application.
        Returns:
        Returns true if all pieces of work are stopped and canceled successfully; returns false otherwise.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - Throws this exception if the connection to the WorkScheduler service fails.
        Since:
        5

      • isLastWorkTimeOut

        public static final boolean isLastWorkTimeOut​(int workId)
                                       throws RemoteException
        Checks whether the last execution of the specified piece of work is a timeout operation. A timeout operation refers to the operation that is put into the waiting queue after its execution duration exceeds the maximum duration allowed.
        Parameters:
        workId - Identifies the piece of work to check.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the last execution of the specified piece of work is a timeout operation; returns false otherwise.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - Throws this exception if the connection to the WorkScheduler service fails.
        Since:
        5
